verses.kjv: Now the men of Israel had sworn in Mizpeh, saying, There shall not any of us give his daughter unto Benjamin to wife.
verses.web: Now the men of Israel had sworn in Mizpah, saying, “None of us will give his daughter to Benjamin as a wife.”
verses.ct: Back at Mizpah, the men of Israel had sworn an oath: "None of us will give our daughters in marriage to anyone from the tribe of Benjamin."

verses.kjv: And the people came to the house of God, and abode there till even before God, and lifted up their voices, and wept sore;
verses.web: The people came to Bethel and sat there until evening before God, and lifted up their voices, and wept severely.
verses.ct: The people went to Bethel and sat there before God until evening, weeping loudly and bitterly.

verses.kjv: And said, O LORD God of Israel, why is this come to pass in Israel, that there should be to day one tribe lacking in Israel?
verses.web: They said, “LORD, the God of Israel, why has this happened in Israel, that there should be one tribe lacking in Israel today?”
verses.ct: They cried out, "LORD, God of Israel, why has this happened? Why is an entire tribe now missing from Israel?"

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the morrow, that the people rose early, and built there an altar, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings.
verses.web: On the next day, the people rose early and built an altar there, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings.
verses.ct: The next morning, the people got up early, built an altar there, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel said, Who is there among all the tribes of Israel that came not up with the congregation unto the LORD? For they had made a great oath concerning him that came not up to the LORD to Mizpeh, saying, He shall surely be put to death.
verses.web: The children of Israel said, “Who is there among all the tribes of Israel who didn’t come up in the assembly to LORD?” For they had made a great oath concerning him who didn’t come up to LORD to Mizpah, saying, “He shall surely be put to death.”
verses.ct: Then the Israelites asked, "Which tribe didn't come to the assembly before the LORD?" They had sworn a solemn oath that anyone who failed to appear before the LORD at Mizpah would be put to death.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel repented them for Benjamin their brother, and said, There is one tribe cut off from Israel this day.
verses.web: The children of Israel grieved for Benjamin their brother, and said, “There is one tribe cut off from Israel today.
verses.ct: The Israelites were filled with grief over Benjamin, their brother tribe. "Today, one tribe has been cut off from Israel," they said.

verses.kjv: How shall we do for wives for them that remain, seeing we have sworn by the LORD that we will not give them of our daughters to wives?
verses.web: How shall we provide wives for those who remain, since we have sworn by LORD that we will not give them of our daughters to wives?”
verses.ct: "How can we find wives for the men who survived? We swore an oath to the LORD that we wouldn't give any of our daughters to them in marriage."

verses.kjv: And they said, What one is there of the tribes of Israel that came not up to Mizpeh to the LORD? And, behold, there came none to the camp from Jabeshgilead to the assembly.
verses.web: They said, “What one is there of the tribes of Israel who didn’t come up to LORD to Mizpah?” Behold, no one came from Jabesh Gilead to the camp to the assembly.
verses.ct: So they asked, "Did any tribe fail to come before the LORD at Mizpah?" When they checked, they discovered that no one from Jabesh Gilead had come to the assembly.

verses.kjv: For the people were numbered, and, behold, there were none of the inhabitants of Jabeshgilead there.
verses.web: For when the people were counted, behold, there were none of the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead there.
verses.ct: A count of the people confirmed it — not a single person from Jabesh Gilead was there.

verses.kjv: And the congregation sent thither twelve thousand men of the valiantest, and commanded them, saying, Go and smite the inhabitants of Jabeshgilead with the edge of the sword, with the women and the children.
verses.web: The congregation sent twelve thousand of the most valiant men there, and commanded them, saying, “Go and strike the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead with the edge of the sword, with the women and the little ones.
verses.ct: So the assembly sent 12,000 of their bravest warriors with these orders: "Go and strike down everyone living in Jabesh Gilead — men, women, and children.

verses.kjv: And this is the thing that ye shall do, Ye shall utterly destroy every male, and every woman that hath lain by man.
verses.web: This is the thing that you shall do: you shall utterly destroy every male, and every woman who has lain with a man.”
verses.ct: Here's exactly what you must do: kill every man and every woman who has slept with a man."

verses.kjv: And they found among the inhabitants of Jabeshgilead four hundred young virgins, that had known no man by lying with any male: and they brought them unto the camp to Shiloh, which is in the land of Canaan.
verses.web: They found among the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead four hundred young virgins who had not known man by lying with him; and they brought them to the camp to Shiloh, which is in the land of Canaan.
verses.ct: Among the people of Jabesh Gilead, they found 400 young women who had never slept with a man. They brought them to the camp at Shiloh, in the land of Canaan.

verses.kjv: And the whole congregation sent some to speak to the children of Benjamin that were in the rock Rimmon, and to call peaceably unto them.
verses.web: The whole congregation sent and spoke to the children of Benjamin who were in the rock of Rimmon, and proclaimed peace to them.
verses.ct: The whole assembly then sent messengers to the surviving Benjaminites hiding at the rock of Rimmon, offering them peace.

verses.kjv: And Benjamin came again at that time; and they gave them wives which they had saved alive of the women of Jabeshgilead: and yet so they sufficed them not.
verses.web: Benjamin returned at that time; and they gave them the women whom they had saved alive of the women of Jabesh Gilead. There still weren’t enough for them.
verses.ct: The men of Benjamin returned, and the Israelites gave them the women they had spared from Jabesh Gilead. But there still weren't enough wives for all of them.

verses.kjv: And the people repented them for Benjamin, because that the LORD had made a breach in the tribes of Israel.
verses.web: The people grieved for Benjamin, because LORD had made a breach in the tribes of Israel.
verses.ct: The people grieved deeply for Benjamin, because the LORD had torn a gap in the tribes of Israel.

verses.kjv: Then the elders of the congregation said, How shall we do for wives for them that remain, seeing the women are destroyed out of Benjamin?
verses.web: Then the elders of the congregation said, “How shall we provide wives for those who remain, since the women are destroyed out of Benjamin?”
verses.ct: The elders of the assembly said, "What can we do to find wives for the men who are left? All the women of Benjamin have been killed."

verses.kjv: And they said, There must be an inheritance for them that be escaped of Benjamin, that a tribe be not destroyed out of Israel.
verses.web: They said, “There must be an inheritance for those who are escaped of Benjamin, that a tribe not be blotted out from Israel.
verses.ct: They continued, "The survivors of Benjamin must have land to pass on to their children, or an entire tribe will be wiped out of Israel.

verses.kjv: Howbeit we may not give them wives of our daughters: for the children of Israel have sworn, saying, Cursed be he that giveth a wife to Benjamin.
verses.web: However, we may not give them wives of our daughters, for the children of Israel had sworn, saying, ‘Cursed is he who gives a wife to Benjamin.’ ”
verses.ct: But we can't give them our own daughters, because the Israelites swore an oath: 'Cursed is anyone who gives a wife to Benjamin.'"

verses.kjv: Then they said, Behold, there is a feast of the LORD in Shiloh yearly in a place which is on the north side of Bethel, on the east side of the highway that goeth up from Bethel to Shechem, and on the south of Lebonah.
verses.web: They said, “Behold, there is a feast of LORD from year to year in Shiloh, which is on the north of Bethel, on the east side of the highway that goes up from Bethel to Shechem, and on the south of Lebonah.”
verses.ct: Then someone said, "There's a yearly festival to the LORD held at Shiloh." Shiloh is north of Bethel, east of the road that runs from Bethel to Shechem, and south of Lebonah.

verses.kjv: Therefore they commanded the children of Benjamin, saying, Go and lie in wait in the vineyards;
verses.web: They commanded the children of Benjamin, saying, “Go and lie in wait in the vineyards,
verses.ct: So they told the men of Benjamin, "Go hide in the vineyards.

verses.kjv: And see, and, behold, if the daughters of Shiloh come out to dance in dances, then come ye out of the vineyards, and catch you every man his wife of the daughters of Shiloh, and go to the land of Benjamin.
verses.web: and see, and behold, if the daughters of Shiloh come out to dance in the dances, then come out of the vineyards, and each man catch his wife of the daughters of Shiloh, and go to the land of Benjamin.
verses.ct: Watch for the young women of Shiloh to come out and dance during the festival. When they do, rush out from the vineyards, and each of you grab a wife for yourself. Then head back to the land of Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, when their fathers or their brethren come unto us to complain, that we will say unto them, Be favourable unto them for our sakes: because we reserved not to each man his wife in the war: for ye did not give unto them at this time, that ye should be guilty.
verses.web: It shall be, when their fathers or their brothers come to complain to us, that we will say to them, ‘Grant them graciously to us, because we didn’t take for each man his wife in battle, neither did you give them to them; otherwise you would now be guilty.’ ”
verses.ct: When their fathers or brothers come to us to complain, we'll tell them, 'Do us a favor and let them keep the women. We didn't get wives for them in battle, and you didn't actually give your daughters to them — so you haven't broken your oath.'"

verses.kjv: And the children of Benjamin did so, and took them wives, according to their number, of them that danced, whom they caught: and they went and returned unto their inheritance, and repaired the cities, and dwelt in them.
verses.web: The children of Benjamin did so, and took wives for themselves according to their number, of those who danced, whom they carried off. They went and returned to their inheritance, built the cities, and lived in them.
verses.ct: The men of Benjamin did exactly that. Each one grabbed a wife from among the dancers and carried her off. Then they returned to their own territory, rebuilt their towns, and settled in them.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel departed thence at that time, every man to his tribe and to his family, and they went out from thence every man to his inheritance.
verses.web: The children of Israel departed from there at that time, every man to his tribe and to his family, and they each went out from there to his own inheritance.
verses.ct: After that, the rest of the Israelites left and went home — each man returning to his own tribe, his own family, and his own land.

verses.kjv: In those days there was no king in Israel: every man did that which was right in his own eyes.
verses.web: In those days there was no king in Israel. Everyone did that which was right in his own eyes.
verses.ct: In those days, Israel had no king. Everyone did whatever they thought was right.
